pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:0.5: 28. The training rule on receiving with attention on the almsbowl
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving almsfood while looking here and there, and they did not know whether people were still giving or whether they had received too much. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.3.1: “‘I will receive almsfood with attention on the almsbowl,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.4: Almsfood is to be received with attention on the bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood while looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk28:1.9: The eighth training rule is finished.
